meanings.definition: (adjective) (of a book or paper) having the corners turned down as a result of use
meanings.sent1: The dogeared book showed how much it had been read.
meanings.sent2: She found a dogeared magazine in the waiting room.
meanings.sent3: The dogeared pages whispered stories of many hands flipping through them.
meanings.sent4: The dogeared notebook was a map of memories.
meanings.sent5: The dogeared pages felt like old friends, familiar and comforting.

meanings.definition: (verb) to fold down the corners of a book or paper
meanings.sent1: He dogeared the pages of his favorite novel to mark his favorite quotes.
meanings.sent2: Please don't dogear the library books.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally dogeared the recipe page while cooking.
meanings.sent4: The student dogeared the textbook for quick reference during the exam.
meanings.sent5: Remember to dogear the page where we left off reading.

meanings.definition: (noun) a book or paper with turned-down corners
meanings.sent1: The dogeared was a sign of a well-loved book.
meanings.sent2: She lent me a dogeared to read over the weekend.
meanings.sent3: The dogeared held all the important notes for the presentation.
meanings.sent4: The dogeared was passed down through generations in the family.
meanings.sent5: The dogeared was filled with annotations and doodles.
